text: Daniel Soulage (14 February 1942 - 14 September 2020) was a French politician. He was born in Monflanquin, Lot-et-Garonne. He was a member of the Senate of France from 2001 to 2011, who represented the Lot-et-Garonne department. He was a member of the Centrist Alliance. Soulage was also Mayor of Monflanquin from 1983 to 2008 and Deputy from 1993 to 1997. Soulage died on 14 September 2020 in Lot-et-Garonne at the age of 78.Lot-et-Garonne : Daniel Soulage nâ€™est plus ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Politicians from Nouvelle-Aquitaine Category:People from Lot-et- Garonne
